name: StringConversionSink
comment:
This class provides an interface for converters to efficiently transmit String data.

Instead of limiting the interface to one non-chunked String it accepts partial strings or can be transformed into a byte sink that accepts UTF-8 code units.

This abstract class will likely get more methods over time. Implementers are urged to extend irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSinkBase or to mix in irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSinkMixin, to ensure that their class covers the newly added methods.

fromStringSink.name: fromStringSink
fromStringSink.comment:
Creates a new instance wrapping the given irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.StringConversionSink-fromStringSink.sink.

Every string that is added to the returned instance is forwarded to the irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.StringConversionSink-fromStringSink.sink. The instance is allowed to buffer and is not required to forward immediately.

addSlice.name: addSlice
addSlice.comment:
Adds the next irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.addSlice.chunk to this.

Adds the substring defined by irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.addSlice.start and irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.addSlice.end-exclusive to this.

If irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.addSlice.isLast is true closes this.

asStringSink.name: asStringSink
asStringSink.comment:
Returns this as a irc_message/dart-convert.ClosableStringSink.

If used, this method must be the first and only call to this. It invalidates this. All further operations must be performed on the result.

asUtf8Sink.name: asUtf8Sink
asUtf8Sink.comment:
Returns this as a sink that accepts UTF-8 input.

If used, this method must be the first and only call to this. It invalidates this. All further operations must be performed on the result.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

add.name: add
add.comment:
Adds chunked data to this sink.

This method is also used when converters are used as irc_message/irc_message.StreamTransformers.

close.name: close
close.comment:
Closes the sink.

This signals the end of the chunked conversion. This method is called when converters are used as irc_message/irc_message.StreamTransformer's.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of irc_message/irc_message.StringConversionSink.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
